title: Unearthing Ancient Ashes: The Mysteries of Africa's First Cremation
description: Archaeologists have made a groundbreaking discovery at a site in Malawi, uncovering the earliest evidence of adult cremation in Africa. This remarkable find dates back 9,500 years and reveals vital insights into the mortuary practices of ancient hunter-gatherer societies.

title: Not Just A Colonial Tool: How South Asia's Native Rulers Championed Archaeology
description: It is indeed true that archaeology in the South Asian Subcontinent was a colonial project that was used as a tool for governance.

title: Ancient African bedrock reveals the violent beginnings of life on our blue planet
description: Young Earth was a blue planet covered in oceans, much like today. But the atmosphere was a lethal cocktail of gases, with no oxygen.
